profile_data.summary:
Building engineering organizations to execute and deliver AI solutions for billions of real users.  
Exceptional record of innovation with 225+ issued US Patents in AI, cybersecurity, and crypto. 
PhD in EECS from UC Berkeley, plus 20 years of technical, leadership, and executive experience.
profile_data.headline: Head of AI at Coinbase | ex-GM at AWS ML Services

experience.description:
* Leading AI (both ML + GenAI) systems, services and platforms for Coinbase. 
* Driving software teams implementing Automation for Coinbase - across CX, Compliance, Institutional and Developer orgs.
* Built and launched Coinbase-GPT, an advanced LLM framework that powers Search and Chat for 10M+ customers, plus Employee AI assistant, Security, Data Science and other internal personas.  
* Using the power of ML to enhance crypto services for web3 - solutions to minimize risk, enhance growth and personalization, predict traffic loads. Novel algorithms on blockchain data. 
* Managing distributed teams across US and India. 
* Responsible for Hiring and Talent Density for all Engineering.
experience.title: Sr. Director, Head of AI & Automation

experience.description:
* Advising Touring Capital (silicon valley VC firm) on investments in the AI space
* Advising several silicon valley startups as a technical advisor
* Angel Investor in firms such as True Foundry
experience.title: Technical Advisor and Angel Investor

experience.description:
* One of most prolific inventors in the industry, with over 225 issued US Patents.
* In three separate projects, developed a research concept into a world-class IP portfolio.
* Winner of Qualcomm’s IP Excellence Award 2015, for driving innovation in the company. This annual award is given to just two inventors in the entire company of 30,000 people.
* Recognized as a Qualcomm Master Inventor, an elite group of 11 “prolific inventors who have made significant contribution to Qualcomm, advancing technology for the company, industry and the world”.
experience.title: Inventor

experience.description:
* Built a new Automation service for AWS, using AI to optimize real-world execution challenges for enterprises.
* As GM, responsible for all aspects of the service including engineering and product, together with bizdev, partnerships, and revenue. Owner of P&L for the service.
* Built strategy for AWS' entrance into this new domain and presented plans to Amazon CEO.
experience.title: GM, Machine Learning Services

experience.description:
* Avast (now acquired by Norton Lifelock for $8.4B) was the largest consumer security company in the world, with 435M+ customers, and $850M+ annual revenue. 
* Responsible for all current AI products and future AI research for the company. 
* Managed a 50+ person AI and Data team in Europe. 
* Major themes: Malware Detection (AV-Comparatives Product of the Year 2019), Adversarial AI, Privacy. AI-driven Network Security for the next-gen SmartHome and IoT Security products.
* Key member of executive strategy team responsible for partnerships and acquisitions. Created the long-term AI plan for Avast IPO (May 2018) and presented to large investors.
experience.title: VP, Head of AI

education.description:
PhD Thesis: "Quality of Service in Ad-Hoc Networks" 
Adviser: Prof. Jean Walrand

MS Thesis: "WebTP: A User-Centric Receiver-Driven Web Transport Protocol"
Advisers: Prof. Jean Walrand and Prof. Steve McCanne

honors.description: Best Paper Awards in QTech Forum, Qualcomm’s internal tech conference.
honors.title: Best paper award at QTech Forum

honors.description: Award for highest score in the Washington D.C. Tri-state area in the Putnam Mathematics Competition.
honors.title: Putnam Awardee

honors.description:
* Fireside Chat with Vitalik Buterin, Machine Learning and Blockchain Research Summit, May 2024
* Coinbase Elevates its AI Capabilities to New Heights, Google Cloud Next, April 2024
* Scaling Machine Learning Systems to Power Billions of Crypto Transactions, Money 20/20, October 2023 
* “The Responsible Use of AI to Enhance Society” – joint keynote with Garry Kasparov, Infosecurity 2019, Mexico City.
* “Using Real AI to Protect Real users (435 million of them)”, Security Seminar at Stanford University and UC Berkeley, Nov 2019.
* “All things considered: An analysis of IoT devices on home networks”, full paper and presentation at Usenix Security 2019, with collaborators at Stanford, UIUC and Avast.
* “Security is AI’s biggest challenge, and AI is Security’s greatest opportunity”, AI Frontiers Conference 2018, San Jose Convention Center. 
* "AI to the Rescue: Protecting Devices from PC to Mobile to IoT”, Global AI Summit 2018, Santa Clara Convention Center.
* “Upcoming Challenges in Mobile Technology”, Stanford University, 2014. 
* “The Great Indoors: The Next Frontier in Location-Based Services”,  University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, 2012. 
* “Dynamic interference management in an ad-hoc deployment”, seminars at Stanford and UC Berkeley, 2010. 
* “Quality of Service in Ad-Hoc Networks”, followup seminars based on PhD Dissertation at UC Berkeley, Caltech, UCLA, UCSD and Univ of Melbourne, Australia.
honors.title: Selected Talks
